data.title: Add Upgrade support to Power/CanPowerDown
data.body:
Another piece for adding DeploysToUpgrade and hopefully fixing WithMakeAnimation.
Requires #6750.

With UpgradeActorsNear, it can be used to require a deployed Construction Yard near by in order to power down. Limiting power would require also using traits like DisableUpgrade.

Will be used for TS GDI power turbines.

data.title: Fixed ICrushable not being triggered properly
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4837, https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5531

And possibly https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3579

data.title: Fixed ProductionQueue freezing Transform
data.body:
This fixes the following:

step 1) with construction yard, have a structure on queue ready to place
step 2) start the construction yard to mcv transform, or sell the construction yard
step 3) before the packing up sequence finishes, place your queued structure
Result) sequence interrupted, structure can no longer transform or sell

data.title: Create a separate SpriteFrameLoader for caching sprite frames.
data.body: Only a few classes used the LoadAllFrames method, and they all use it with a transient cache. By moving the LoadAllFrames method into a new class, we can skip the now redundant frame cache in SpriteLoader, saving on memory significantly since the frame data array can be reclaimed by the GC. This saves ~58 MiB on frames and ~4 MiB on the caching dictionary in simple tests.

data.body:
On the beachhead mission, the units the hovercraft is carrying ~~are drawn behind it for some reason~~ are inside it as if it were a RA1 landing craft

data.title: Release more sheet buffers
data.body:
Followup to #5712 - releases more sheet buffers allowing 96 MiB of memory to be freed.

Some background for anybody unfamiliar: prior to #5712, the Sheet class would permanently hold a reference to a managed copy of the texture it was representing. This is for performance as making small incremental updates was faster than getting and setting texture data from the texture itself all the time. Instead the changes were batched up in the managed buffer and committed on demand to the texture.
#5712 introduced a method to allow this buffer to be marked for release once committed to the texture. If no more incremental updates are planned this allows the buffer memory to be reclaimed. This is important because these buffers can be very large.

Even after #5712 there were still some sheets with buffers that stuck around, allocated by:
MapCache (16m)
SpriteFont (16m)
VoxelLoader (16m)
SequenceCache \* 4 (16m) (one per tileset)

This PR address 6 of those 7 sheets, freeing an additional 96 MiB.

The data buffer is now generated lazily, which solves the problem for VoxelLoader.
The 4 SequenceCache sheets are released as part of preloading the sequences - when preloading everything we know we won't be needing the buffer again later.
The MapCache sheet is now released when the map generation thread dies. In this particular case the texture may not get rendered for a while, so we make a manual call to force the buffer to be written to the texture after which it can be freed.

This only leaves a buffer for the SpriteFont sheet. When text is drawn the glyphs are lazily generated and so we can't easily get rid of the buffer without impacting either performance or flexibility.

data.title: Counterintuitive lobby options behaviour when switching maps/servers.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
1.
if i load a map on my server , where the "default map options" are changed (without any input from myself)  , it wont give me a message in the chat window ... 

2.
when the "default map options" have been changed (without any input from myself) drop-zone map is a good example ... and i load  "haos ridge" with the basic map-options set ... then .... the map-options (check-box to be specific) wont change , so it stays on the "dropzone map options" ... and no message will pop up to give a hint 

this is a problem specially for dedicated servers , when the server has currently a drop-zone map loadet , admins change the map to something else ... but dont check the options ... and theres no message that anything has been changed ... once the game starts ... it will most likely result in a "RE" and players blame the Admin for changing the options without telling them ... (but he most likely didnt even know himself)

just so you know what i mean : 

download playtest 
create a server (or join a dedicated)
load map "haos ridge" (check options) 
load a"dropzone" map (check options) 
load map "haos ridge" again (check options and chat-window)

![map options](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/4632628/951e29e8-53bf-11e4-9ffd-a2b021e070d5.png)

I think the most interesting question here is ... "if" a dedicated server ... like hetzners for example ... "automatically" get maps from http://resource.openra.net/ ... 

and the "default rules" for maps have been overwritten (as in dropzone maps) .... 

does every new loadet map start with the drop-zone map options ?

Closes #2281, #4577.

data.title: Added IDisabledTrait & UpgradableTrait with upgrade levels support
data.body:
- IDisabledTrait for identifying (and filtering) disabled traits
- UpgradeEnabledDisabledTrait provides an abstract base for enabling by upgrade and disabling by upgrade

data.title: Reorganize mod folders
data.body:
There are a few things that have been bugging me for a while, with regard to how the mod folders are organized. In my opinion,
1. weapons.yaml should be either
   - moved into the rules folder, or
   - moved into its own weapons folder, and then split into roughly categorized yamls (e.g. machineguns, ballistics, missiles, heat [fire and lasers], other) to make navigation easier (I already do that for both projects I'm working on).
     To have it in the mods' main folder is rather unintuitive.
2. Yamls related to defining music, movies, notifications, voices and maybe missions as well should be moved into a subfolder. I can't come up with a one-word folder name that makes this purpose clear enough though, `contentdefinitions` is a bit long...
3. To have a `chrome.yaml` which defines ui element graphics and sizes, a `metrics.yaml` which sets some UI defaults and a `chrome` subfolder with lots of widget yamls is highly confusing to any new modder not familiar with OpenRA. For starters, `chrome` itself is a relatively non-descriptive term. My suggestion would be to rename the `chrome` folder to `uiwidgets` or just  `ui`, rename `chrome.yaml` to `uielements.yaml`, and `metrics.yaml` to `uimetrics.yaml`. Then people would understand right away what contains what.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5263058-reorganize-mod-folders?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Lua callbacks should be run from a FrameEndTask.
data.body:
```
07:36 < abcdefg30> [02:45:45] Trigger.OnCapture(building, function() Trigger.ClearAll(building) end) shouldn't crash the game, should it?
07:36 <+antares79> [03:05:52] abcdefg30: ideally not ;) how does it crash?
07:36 < abcdefg30> [03:07:47] Die Auflistung wurde gendert. Der Enumerationsvorgang kann mglicherweise nicht ausgefhrt werden.
07:36 < abcdefg30> [03:08:32] do you know german?
07:36 <+antares79> [03:08:56] ah... wrap the clearAll in a Trigger.AfterDelay(0, function() Trigger.ClearAll(building) end)
07:36 <+antares79> [03:08:59] yes
07:36 < abcdefg30> [03:09:18] ok moment
07:36 <+antares79> [03:11:44] the reason is that the OnCapture callback function is stored on exactly the same list that ClearAll would clear, and the list cannot be modified while it is being iterated (which it is at the moment that OnCapture runs)
07:36 <+antares79> [03:12:33] that should probably be changed in the code, I stumbled over that only later myself
```

Running lua callbacks in a FrameEndTask would add a lot of robustness against errors like this.

data.title: Fix ChangeOwner bogosity.
data.body:
This adds support for changing owner from within map scripts, and fixes the traits that were incorrectly using `INotifyCapture` to update their internal references (pretty much all of them).

The need for these fixes can be demonstrated by adding the following to allies02:

``` lua
    proc = Actor.Create("proc", true, { Owner = ukraine, Location = DeployPoint.Location - CVec.New(10, 0)})
    pbox = Actor.Create("pbox", true, { Owner = ukraine, Location = DeployPoint.Location - CVec.New(12, 0)})
    Trigger.AfterDelay(50, function()
        proc.Owner = player
        pbox.Owner = player
        Actor.Create("harv", true, { Owner = player, Location = DeployPoint.Location - CVec.New(7, 0) })
    end)
```

Before 543abd3, ejecting the pillbox will produce a soviet soldier that will attack you, and your harvester will not be able to unload.

I have organized this so that changing the owner of refineries or resource storage will update the references, but not grant the capture bonuses (stealing the harvester / resources).
